target: He shivered and turned over, trying to get comfortable, his stomach rumbling with hunger
context2: Dudley’s snores were drowned by the low rolls of thunder that started near midnight.

context1: Hagrid was so huge that he parted the crowd easily; all Harry had to do was keep close behind him.
target: They passed book shops and music stores, hamburger restaurants and cinemas, but nowhere that looked as if it could sell you a magic wand.
context2: This was just an ordinary street full of ordinary people.
